eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: westboy, daliyoucefmedakram@gmail.com
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

Add the behavior to a Text object (or BBText object) and choose the interval between characters.

* When the text changes, the automatic typing starts again from the beginning with the new text.
* You can change the speed of the text typing by changing the interval with events.
* Use a condition to check if the typing finished.
* You can also pause the typing and resume it after.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Auto typing animation for texts ("typewriter" effect)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: AutoTyping
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Useful for dialogue scenes or visual novels.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Animate the text to simulate it being written character by character (also called "typewriter" effect), with a customizable time between each character. Add the behavior to the object, and it will get animated when the text is changed. You can also pause/resume it.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Text_AutoTyping

eventsFunctions.description: Execute actions when the auto typing text ends.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingFinished

eventsFunctions.description: Pause animation auto typing.
eventsFunctions.name: Pause

eventsFunctions.description: Resume auto typing after pause.
eventsFunctions.name: Resume

eventsFunctions.description: Detect if the auto typing is on pause.
eventsFunctions.name: TypingPause

eventsFunctions.description: Change the time between characters being typed.
eventsFunctions.name: ChangeInterval
eventsFunctions.sentence: Set the interval between characters of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
After adding this to an object, you have to **trigger the effect** by using the **Flash action**.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Flash
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Make the object flash (blink) for a period of time, so that it is alternately visible and invisible.
Trigger the effect by using the Flash action.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Flash

eventsFunctions.description: Make the specified object(s) blink for the given duration.
eventsFunctions.name: Flash

parameters.description: Duration of the blinking, in seconds
parameters.name: FlashDuration

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the specified objects are flashing.
eventsFunctions.name: IsFlashing

eventsFunctions.description: Stop the flashing of the specified object
eventsFunctions.name: Stop

propertyDescriptors.label: Half period (time during which object is invisible), in seconds
propertyDescriptors.name: HalfPeriodTime

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: VegeTato, Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description:
Run the provided action (*on every frame*, i.e: without a condition) to make the orbiting objects move.
The extension will take care of creating/deleting orbiting objects to match the quantity specified. 
Use the delete function or set the quantity to 0 to remove orbiting objects.

The customizable parameters include:
- Which center object to use
- Orbiting object (cannot be the same object used for the Center object)
- Quantity of orbiting objects
- Distance from the center object
- Speed of the orbiting objects (in degrees per second).  Use negative numbers to orbit counter-clockwise.
- Speed to rotate each orbiting object (in degrees per second).  Use negative numbers to rotate counter-clockwise.

Example uses:
- Make shield objects around the player to protect from enemies
- Weapons that can damage enemies when they collide
- Can be used on both player and NPC objects 
- A visual indicator of ammo quantity or health points
- Interesting animations that can function as a single entity (try using short orbit distances)
- Visual cue for an active character power-up, such as invincibility
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Make objects orbit around a center object
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: OrbitingObjects
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Make objects orbit around a center object. You can customize the number of objects, speed, etc...

eventsFunctions.description: Make objects orbit around a center object.  Objects will be automatically created/deleted to match the quantity.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Make objects orbit around a center object
eventsFunctions.name: AnimateOrbitingObjects
eventsFunctions.sentence: Animate _PARAM3_ copies of _PARAM2_ that orbit around _PARAM1_ at a distance of _PARAM5_ with orbit speed of _PARAM4_ degrees per second. Rotate orbiting objects at _PARAM6_ degrees per second.  Start objects with an angle offset of _PARAM9_ degrees.  Create objects on layer _PARAM7_ with Z value _PARAM8_.  Reset locations of orbiting objects after quantity is reduced: _PARAM10_

events.name: Count the number of linked objects (always)

events.comment: Note:  Must use the Action form of "Take into account" so that this variable is set to 0 when there are no linked objects
Create orbiting objects and link them to the center object
Match the angle used by the rest of the orbiting objects
Calculate new angle for this frame
Save the current angle so it can be used for new orbiting objects

parameters.longDescription: Cannot be the same object used for the Center object
parameters.name: OrbitingObject

parameters.longDescription: Use negative numbers to orbit counter-clockwise
parameters.name: OrbitSpeed

parameters.description: Distance from the center object (in pixels)
parameters.name: OrbitDistance

parameters.longDescription: Use negative numbers to rotate counter-clockwise
parameters.name: ObjectRotationSpeed

parameters.description: Layer that orbiting objects will be created on (base layer if empty)
parameters.name: OrbitLayer

parameters.description: Reset locations of orbiting objects after quantity is reduced
parameters.name: ResetObjectsAfterDeletion

eventsFunctions.description: Delete orbiting objects that are linked to a center object
eventsFunctions.fullName: Delete orbiting objects that are linked to a center object
eventsFunctions.name: DeleteOrbitingObjects
eventsFunctions.sentence: Delete all _PARAM2_ that are linked to _PARAM1_

parameters.longDescription: Cannot be the same object that was used for the Center object
parameters.name: OrbitingObject

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsFunctionsExtensions.fullName: Health (life points and damages for objects)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Health
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Add actions and conditions to manage the life of the object. Object can get damages, lose some health and you can check with a condition if it's dead.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Health

eventsFunctions.description: Add some damage to the object, decreasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Hit

parameters.description: Value of the damage to do (will be removed from object health)
parameters.name: DamageValue

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object is considered dead (no more health)
eventsFunctions.name: IsDead

eventsFunctions.description: Check if the object was just damaged previously in the events.
eventsFunctions.name: IsJustDamaged

eventsFunctions.description: Heal the object, incrasing its life.
eventsFunctions.name: Heal

parameters.description: How much to heal (will be added to object health)
parameters.name: HealValue

eventsFunctions.description: Change the object health to set it to a specific value (check if the actions to damage or heal the object are not better suited to your use case before using this one).
eventsFunctions.name: SetHealth

eventsFunctions.description: The health of the object
eventsFunctions.name: Health

propertyDescriptors.label: Damage cooldown (in seconds) (0 for no cooldown)
propertyDescriptors.name: DamageCooldown
